adjectives.description: rebated (comparative more rebated, superlative most rebated)

entries.meaning: Blunted, dulled (of a blade, weapon etc.). [from 16th c.]
examples: Even with blunted lances and filed-down or ‘rebated’ blades, grave injury and death were all too frequent, and tended to ‘disturb the cheerfulness of such events’, as a contemporary Spanish herald understatedly put it.

entries.meaning: (military, of the rim of a firearm cartridge) Having a smaller diameter than the main body of the cartridge, from which it is separated by an extractor groove narrower than both.
simple past tense and past participle of rebate
